TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TableRowCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<class System.Windows.Documents.TableRow>, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.Windows.Documents.TableRow>, class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.Windows.Documents.TableRow>, class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList

Docs.summary: Provides standard facilities for creating and managing a type-safe, ordered collection of objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This collection supports standard zero-based indexing.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowGroup.Rows%2A> property provided by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowGroup> class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Add(class System.Windows.Documents.TableRow item) cil managed

Docs.param: A table row to append to the collection or rows.
Docs.summary: Appends a specified item to the collection.
Docs.exception: Raised when *item* already belongs to a collection.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the pre-allocated collection item capacity for this collection.
Docs.value: The pre-allocated collection item capacity for this collection. The default value is **8**.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Capacity%2A> property represents the number of pre-allocated slots for storing items in this collection, whereas the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Count%2A> property represents the actual number of items currently in the collection. The value of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Capacity%2A> is always at least as large as the value of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Count%2A>.
When newly added collection items cause the collection count to exceed the collection capacity, the capacity is automatically increased to accommodate the newly added collection items. Increasing the collection capacity involves allocating additional collection slots, which incurs both performance and memory overhead. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Capacity%2A> property to optimize the collection capacity in cases where the total or maximum number of collection items is known in advance. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.TrimToSize%2A> method to cause the collection capacity to equalized with the current collection count.

Docs.exception: Raised when an attempt is made to set to a value that is less than the current value of .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears all items from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks After calling <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Clear%2A>, the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Count%2A> property becomes **0** and the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Capacity%2A> property is unchanged. To set a new capacity, call <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.TrimToSize%2A> or explicitly set a new capacity through the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Capacity%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Contains(class System.Windows.Documents.TableRow item) cil managed

Docs.param: An item to query for the presence of in the collection.
Docs.summary: Queries for the presence of a specified item in the collection.
Docs.returns: **true** if the specified *item* is present in the collection; otherwise, **false**.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyTo(class System.Array array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: A one-dimensional array to which the collection contents will be copied. This array must use zero-based indexing.
A zero-based index in array specifying the position at which to begin inserting the copied collection objects.
Docs.summary: Copies the contents of the collection and inserts them into a specified array starting at a specified index position in the array.
Docs.exception: Raised when *array* includes items that are not compatible with the type , or if *arrayIndex* specifies a position that falls outside of the bounds of *array*.

Docs.param: A one-dimensional array to which the collection contents will be copied. This array must use zero-based indexing.
A zero-based index in array specifying the position at which to begin inserting the copied collection objects.
Docs.summary: Copies the contents of the collection and inserts them into a specified array of starting at a specified index position in the array.
Docs.exception: Raised when *array* includes items that are not compatible with the type , or if *arrayIndex* specifies a position that falls outside of the bounds of *array*.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items currently contained by the collection.
Docs.value: The number of items currently contained by the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Capacity%2A> property represents the number of pre-allocated slots for storing items in this collection, whereas the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Count%2A> property represents the actual number of items currently in the collection. The value of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Capacity%2A> is always at least as large as the value of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Count%2A>.
When newly added collection items cause the collection count to exceed the collection capacity, the capacity is automatically increased to accommodate the newly added collection items. Increasing the collection capacity involves allocating additional collection slots, which incurs both performance and memory overhead. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Capacity%2A> property to optimize the collection capacity in cases where the total or maximum number of collection items is known in advance. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.TrimToSize%2A> method to cause the collection capacity to equalized with the current collection count.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 IndexOf(class System.Windows.Documents.TableRow item) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection item to return the index of.
Docs.summary: Returns the zero-based index of specified collection item.
Docs.returns: The zero-based index of the specified collection item, or **-1** if the specified item is not a member of the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Insert (int index, System.Windows.Documents.TableRow item);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Insert(int32 index, class System.Windows.Documents.TableRow item) cil managed

Docs.param: A zero-based index that specifies the position in the collection at which to insert item.
An item to insert into the collection.
Docs.summary: Inserts a specified item in the collection at a specified index position.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Count%2A> equals <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Capacity%2A> for this collection, the collection capacity automatically is increased before the new item is inserted. Set *index* equal to the value of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection.Count%2A>, to append a new collection item to the collection.
Indices for existing collection items may be adjusted to accommodate the newly inserted collection item.

Docs.param: A zero-based index specifying the position of the collection item to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets the collection item at a specified index. This is an indexed property.
Docs.value: The collection item at the specified index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is an indexed property that supports standard indexing syntax (similar to that used to access a particular cell in an array).

Docs.exception: Raised when *index* is less than zero, or when *index* is greater than or equal to .

Docs.summary: Removes a specified item from the collection.
Docs.returns: **true** if the specified item was found and removed; otherwise, **false**.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Indices for remaining collection items may be adjusted to reflect the removed collection item.

Docs.exception: Raised if *item* is not present in the collection.

.method public hidebysig instance void RemoveRange(int32 index, int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: A zero-based index indicating the beginning of a range of items to remove.
The number of items to remove, beginning form the position specified by index.
Docs.summary: Removes a range of items, specified by beginning index and count, from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Indices for remaining collection items may be adjusted to reflect the removed collection items.

Docs.exception: Raised when *index* or *count* is less than zero, or when *index* is greater than or equal to .
Raised when *index* and *count* do not specify a valid range in this collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void TrimToSize() cil managed

Docs.summary: Optimizes memory consumption for the collection by setting the underlying collection equal to the of items currently in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method can be used to minimize memory overhead for a collection, particularly if the set of items contained by the collection is expected to be static.
